law.catch_line: The Board consists of the following five members:...

text.section:
The Board consists of the following five members:
one member appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate representing the public, who:
is not an officer or employee of the State or a State employee organization; and
is not an elected official of the State or a State employee organization;
two members with knowledge of labor issues chosen from a list of candidates submitted by each exclusive representative, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate, who:
are not officers or employees of the State or a State employee organization; and
are known for objective and independent judgment; and
two members of the business community, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate, who:
are not officers or employees of the State or a State employee organization; and
are known for objective and independent judgment.
Before taking office, each member shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.
From among its members, the Board shall elect a chairman.

section.section: The term of a member is 6 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on July 1, 2006.
A vacancy shall be filled for an unexpired term in the same manner as an original appointment.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member only for incompetence or misconduct.

In making appointments to the Board, the Governor shall ensure, to the extent practicable, that:
the ratio of male to female members and the racial makeup of the Board is reflective of the general population of the State; and
each major geographic area of the State is represented on the Board.
